description: Scientists detected the first long-predicted gravitational wave in 2015, and since then, researchers have been hungering for better detectors. But the Earth is warm and seismically noisy, and that will always limit the effectiveness of Earth-based detectors.
title: Here's why we should put a gravitational wave observatory on the moon

description: The impact of human activities—such as greenhouse gas emissions and deforestation—on Earth's surface have been well-studied. Now, hydrology researchers from the University of Arizona have investigated how humans impact Earth's deep subsurface, a zone that lies hundreds of meters to several kilometers beneath the planet's surface.
title: Human activities have an intense impact on Earth's deep subsurface fluid flow

description: Over the last 25 years, the ozone hole which forming over Antarctica each spring has started to shrink.
title: Longer-lasting ozone holes over Antarctica expose seal pups and penguin chicks to much more UV

description: In the two decades to 2019, global plastic production doubled. By 2040, plastic manufacturing and processing could consume as much as 20% of global oil production and use up 15% of the annual carbon emissions budget.
title: If plastic manufacturing goes up 10%, plastic pollution goes up 10%—and we're set for a huge surge in production

description: I first encountered the three-body problem 60 years ago, in a short story called "Placet is a Crazy Place" by American science fiction writer Frederic Brown.
title: The planetary orbit in Netflix's '3 Body Problem' is random and chaotic, but could it exist?

description: An international team of archaeologists and archaeogenetics specialists, working with the Hungarian National Museum, has discovered a network of Avar pedigrees and community social practices after conducting a DNA study of the remains of people who once lived in what is now a part of Hungary.
title: DNA study of Avar cemetery remains reveals network of large pedigrees and social practices
